name: quicklime production, milled, loose | quicklime, milled, loose | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/3374/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of milled quicklime. The infrastructure data is estimated based on a tour and sketches of the process, and normalized with a annual production capacity of about 23'000 tons of product per year. There are no significant dust emissions as a dust control system is installed. ;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From the reception of quicklime at the factory gate.

This activity ends with the quicklime produced. The dataset includes the different production processes (crushing, milling, filtering (cyclone), dedusting, transportation, and storing), the total heating energy for "production" and "administration", and the infrastructure.
category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2394:Manufacture of cement, lime and plaster

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data is based on a Swiss company.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Data is based on the Swiss current technology. The company KFN works on a technically high level. Effective dust control systems are installed.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: data which are only available for RER have been used as proxy for CH

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=CH
Quicklime is produced by the thermal decomposition of limestone. It consists mainly of calcium oxide. Its quality depends on many factors, including physical properties, degree of sintering and chemical composition. As the most readily available and cost effective alkali, quicklime plays an essential part in a wide variety of industrial processes.

The difference between clinker and quicklime used for products in the binding agent industry is mainly the calcination temperature which is a maximum of 1’450ºC for clinker and a maximum of 1’200ºC for quicklime.

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=CH
Estimation, based on company data. The total amount of milled quicklime used by 2001 was 22.744t. Possible losses due to dust emissions were neglected.
Activity link justification: precursor production and consumption occur on the same site.
